avalancheActivity.comment:
5 to 15 cm of snow, and up to 20 cm in some localities, will fall on Wednesday above approximately 1200 m. The older wind slabs will be covered with new snow in some cases and therefore difficult to recognise. Individual avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular on steep shady slopes at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions and in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain.

At low and intermediate altitudes only a little snow is lying. Watch out for the numerous rocks hidden by the recent snow.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The older wind slabs will be covered with new snow in some cases and therefore difficult to recognise.

snowpackStructure.comment: In all aspects thus far only a little snow is lying in all altitude zones. Towards its base, the snowpack consists of faceted crystals, especially on steep shady slopes at intermediate and high altitudes. The new snow will be deposited on a crust on sunny slopes and at low and intermediate altitudes. Above the tree line: The older wind slabs will be covered with new snow in some cases and therefore difficult to recognise.

avalancheActivity.comment:
Some snow will fall on Wednesday. The avalanche danger will persist. The wind slabs of last week must be evaluated with care and prudence in particular on north to east to south facing aspects above approximately 2600 m, in particular at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack, when entering gullies and bowls for example. They are lying on weak layers in particular on steep shady slopes at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions.

The Avalanche Warning Service currently has only a small amount of information that has been collected in the field, so that the avalanche danger should be investigated especially thoroughly in the relevant locality.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Weak layers in the old snowpack represent the main danger. The old wind slabs are lying on unfavourable layers in particular on shady slopes.

snowpackStructure.comment:
From a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying, especially at low and intermediate altitudes.
The old wind slabs are lying on unfavourable layers in particular on shady slopes. Towards its base, the snowpack consists of faceted crystals.

avalancheActivity.comment:
5 to 10 cm of snow will fall on Wednesday above approximately 1200 m. The avalanche danger will persist. Below approximately 2200 m from a snow sport perspective, insufficient snow is lying. Watch out for the numerous rocks hidden by the recent snow.

Individual avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular on steep shady slopes at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions and adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls, where The sometimes new snow-covered wind slabs are lying on weak layers. Along the border with France and in the regions exposed to heavier precipitation the avalanche situation is a little more dangerous.
avalancheActivity.highlights: At high altitudes and in high Alpine regions the avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls.

snowpackStructure.comment: In all aspects thus far only a little snow is lying in all altitude zones. Towards its base, the snowpack consists of faceted crystals, especially on shady slopes. The new snow will be deposited on a crust on sunny slopes. Will be deposited on soft layers in particular on shady slopes.
